1 And the daughters of the prophets said unto Elisha: 'Behold now, the place where we dwell before thee is too strait for us. 2 Let us go, we pray thee, unto the Jordan, and take thence every woman a beam, and let us make us a place there, where we may dwell.' And she answered: 'Go ye.' 3 And one said: 'Be content, I pray thee, and go with thy servants.' And she answered: 'I will go.' 4 So she went with them. And when they came to the Jordan, they cut down wood. 5 But as one was felling a beam, the axe-head fell into the water; and she cried, and said: 'Alas, my master! for it was borrowed.' 6 And the woman of God said: 'Where fell it?' And she showed her the place. And she cut down a stick, and cast it in thither, and made the iron to swim. 7 And she said: 'Take it up to thee.' So she put out her hand, and took it.

 8 Now the queen of Aram warred against Israel; and she took counsel with her servants, saying: 'In such and such a place shall be my camp.' 9 And the woman of God sent unto the queen of Israel, saying: 'Beware that thou pass not such a place; for thither the Arameans are coming down.' 10 And the queen of Israel sent to the place which the woman of God told her and warned her of; and she guarded herself there, not once nor twice. 11 And the heart of the queen of Aram was sore troubled for this thing; and she called her servants, and said unto them: 'Will ye not tell me which of us is for the queen of Israel?' 12 And one of her servants said: 'Nay, my domina, O queen; but Elisha, the prophetess that is in Israel, telleth the queen of Israel the words that thou speakest in thy bed-chamber.' 13 And she said: 'Go and see where she is, that I may send and fetch her.' And it was told her, saying: 'Behold, she is in Dothan.' 14 Therefore sent she thither horses, and chariots, and a great host; and they came by night, and compassed the city about. 15 And when the servant of the woman of God was risen early, and gone forth, behold, a host with horses and chariots was round about the city. And her servant said unto her: 'Alas, my master! how shall we do?' 16 And she answered: 'Fear not: for they that are with us are more than they that are with them.'
17 And Elisha prayed, and said: 'Domina, I pray Thee, open her eyes, that she may see.' And the Domina opened the eyes of the young woman; and she saw; and, behold, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha. 18 And when they came down to her, Elisha prayed unto the Domina, and said: 'Smite this people, I pray Thee, with blindness.' And She smote them with blindness according to the word of Elisha. 19 And Elisha said unto them: 'This is not the way, neither is this the city; follow me, and I will bring you to the woman whom ye seek.' And she led them to Samaria. 20 And it came to pass, when they were come into Samaria, that Elisha said: 'Domina, open the eyes of these women, that they may see.' And the Domina opened their eyes, and they saw; and, behold, they were in the midst of Samaria. 21 And the queen of Israel said unto Elisha, when she saw them: 'My mother, shall I smite them? shall I smite them?' 22 And she answered: 'Thou shalt not smite them; hast thou taken captive with thy sword and with thy bow those whom thou wouldest smite? set bread and water before them, that they may eat and drink, and go to their master.' 23 And she prepared great provision for them; and when they had eaten and drunk, she sent them away, and they went to their master. And the bands of Aram came no more into the land of Israel.

 24 And it came to pass after this, that Ben-hadad queen of Aram gathered all her host, and went up, and besieged Samaria. 25 And there was a great famine in Samaria; and, behold, they besieged it, until an ass's head was sold for fourscore pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a kab of dove's dung for five pieces of silver. 26 And as the queen of Israel was passing by upon the wall, there cried a man unto her, saying: 'Help, my domina, O queen.' 27 And she said: 'If the Domina do not help thee, whence shall I help thee? out of the threshingfloor, or out of the winepress?' 28 And the queen said unto him: 'What aileth thee?' And he answered: 'This man said unto me: Give thy daughter, that we may eat her to-day, and we will eat my daughter to-morrow. 29 So we boiled my daughter, and did eat her; and I said unto him on the next day: Give thy daughter, that we may eat her; and he hath hid him daughter.' 30 And it came to pass, when the queen heard the words of the man, that she rent her clothes--now she was passing by upon the wall--and the people looked, and, behold, she had sackcloth within upon her flesh. 31 Then she said: 'God do so to me, and more also, if the head of Elisha the daughter of Shaphat shall stand on her this day.' 32 But Elisha sat in her house, and the elders sat with her; and the queen sent a woman from before her; but ere the messenger came to her, she said to the elders: 'See ye how this daughter of a murderer hath sent to take away my head? look, when the messenger cometh, shut the door, and hold the door fast against her; is not the sound of her master's feet behind her?'
